intro: Monnina sylvicola, commonly known as the woodland bluemink, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. Monnina sylvicola plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in forest understories.
